fields.summary: Searching for key gets obviously wrong results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37828].
  {panel}

Steps to replicate:

# In OnDemand, create a JIRA dashboard and add the 'activity stream' gadget. Ensure this gadget shows Confluence activity
# In a linked Confluence OnDemand instance, create a page
# Return to the previously created dashboard and hit 'comment' below the activity item created by the actions in step 2
# Enter any text and then click 'Add'

Result:

The error 'There was an error communicating with the remote server.' is thrown:

!comment_error.png!

And the following appears in the logs:

{noformat}
2014-04-08 14:35:51.506146500 2014-04-08 14:35:51,506 com.atlassian.mywork.client.reliability.DefaultUnreliableWorker:thread-1 WARN sysadmin 875x205x4 35smdp 59.167.133.1,59.167.29.201 /plugins/servlet/streamscomments [apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector] Unable to respond to any of these challenges: {oauth=OAuth realm="https%3A%2F%2Fexample.atlassian.net%2Fwiki"}
2014-04-08 14:35:56.482055500 2014-04-08 14:35:56,481 TP-Processor3 WARN sysadmin 875x230x1 35smdp 59.167.133.1,59.167.29.201 /plugins/servlet/streamscomments [streams.internal.servlet.StreamsCommentsServlet] Logged an error while posting comment: REMOTE_POST_REPLY_ERROR
{noformat}

Expected Result:

A comment is added to the Confluence page
fields.summary: Unable to comment on Confluence page via JIRA Activity Stream

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37827].
  {panel}

This is from the video you sent in an email (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tvUnF6RGD1Q) :

at 1:41 , she talks about a cheat sheet, and there's a link displayed (atlss.in/workflowguide) . 
putting that into the browser brings you to a page, that says "Workflows Guidebooks" , and "Page deleted".

here's a screen shot as well :)
fields.summary: PDF cheat sheet from youtube leads to page deleted
Post function to populate a custom field with the user who initiated a given transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37823].
  {panel}

When creating a new issue the Cancel button is right next to the Add button and is far too easy to hit by accident, potentially losing a lot of work.

Please eliminate the Cancel button (or at least offer a preference so admins can eliminate it). It isn't really needed and it is far too dangerous.

For an example of a system that has no Cancel button try a Trac system. We used Trac for years and never missed having a Cancel button, nor did we ever lose any work to it.

The problem is exacerbated by having a preview mode (instead of using live preview, as Trac can do with a plugin); it is possible to think that Cancel will just leave preview mode. It has happened.

(An alternative that would be better than nothing is to move the Cancel button to the right edge, so it is far away from Add).
fields.summary: Please eliminate (perhaps optionally) the Cancel button
User Picker fields should ignore accents or diacritic in full names
Drag & Drop attachments
Improve usability of linked statuss
Improve unsupported browser messages to indicate which browsers are supported
Provide clear instructions when java is not installed for IE8/9/10 users
JIRA automating backup service configuration 'Date format' field lacks intuitive help
Enable TLS 1.2 by default in JIRA standalone distribution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37808].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# Add the Filter Results gadget.
# Choose a filter, and save it.
# Click the cog on an issue in the list, and choose "Add Field"

You're redirected and the server gives a HTTP 400.

Probably what we want to do is get rid of the option form the menu, rather than fix it. This option makes no sense in this context. If nobody complains in a few months and we haven't fixed it, we should just resolve this issue; fixing it would be a waste of time given the uselessness of it.
fields.summary: Adding a field from the Filter Results gadget fails
Admin able to lock themselves out of an instance

fields.description:
Safari doesn't support HTML5 image pasting from the clipboard as per http://codebits.glennjones.net/copypaste/pasteimagedata.htm — attempting to paste currently throws an JavaScript error:

{noformat}
TypeError: 'undefined' is not an object (evaluating 'screenshotPasteHandler.dialogView.pasteCatcher.childNodes[0]')
{noformat}

This suggests the code will need to be different Safari than other browsers.

*Testing notes*
* Ensure latest Safari on OSX works.
* Ensure QUnit tests pass.
fields.summary: Fix image paste support for Safari.

fields.summary: Exception rendering ticket after deleting priority

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37794].
  {panel}

h6. Overview
The list of versions gives the options to move an entry up or down the list as required. Previously, the browser would automatically scroll the page when you drag a version to the top or bottom of the screen. This no longer happens. It forces users to move a version to the correct location in numerous small steps.
!drag_version.JPG|thumbnail!

h6. Workaround
By using a mouse wheel to scroll the page whilst dragging a version but this obviously isn't possible on mobile devices. 

h6. Proposed solution
Can the view be set to scroll again when versions are moved (via drag and drop)?
fields.summary: Manage Version page does not automatically scroll down
@Mention Project Role

fields.description:
Receiving Internal Server Error Message when merging versions in JIRA

create new version
press merge
merge version into the newly created version
internal server error message displays
fields.summary: Internal Server Error

fields.description:
When copying text from an HTML formated Outlook message into a comment to a JIRA ticket, we get the error shown in the screen shot.

We debugged this the following way:
1. Copy text into Windows Editor; this shows some control characters.
2. Delete control and - just to be shure - other special characters.
3. Copy this clean text into the comment in JIRA - all is fine.

We did not check wether the same happens if you copy the control characters into other issue fields like description or summary.
fields.summary: "Communications Breakdown" error message shown when pasting control characters into a new comment
Export JIRA Release Notes to Confluence Knowledge Base

fields.description:
Ideally we can avoid browser detection, and instead opt for feature detection instead. See https://github.com/Modernizr/Modernizr/pull/659 for a discussion of approaches. It may be that we need to do browser detection.

*Testing notes*
* In IE8, IE9, IE10, the Java applet should be used, if it's installed, otherwise it should show "unsupported".
* In all other browsers (IE11, latest FF, Chrome, Safari), the HTML5 version should be used.
* Check IE10 in Windows 8 VM from http://modern.ie — [~gtanczyk] had problems in the past.
* Ensure QUnit tests pass.
fields.summary: Write feature detection for image data clipboard paste.
"Attach Screenshot" item appears twice in "More" menu on View Issue page

fields.description:
Users are not able to open a new ticket whether defect or other type of ticket through Jira.  Here is the error message that is given when the try to submit the ticket.
"Assignee: The default assignee does NOT have ASSIGNABLE permission OR Unassigned issues are turned off."
What do we need to change to get this to work
fields.summary: Users not able to open a new Jira Ticket after upgrade to 6.1.7

fields.description:
We set up a collector to create bugs from an email account at our company.  I noticed that the bug number does not increment contiguously as would be expected (BUG-3, BUG-4, BUG-5, etc.)  Instead it seems to vary wildly.  Real issues: TEMP-1428, TEMP-1431, TEMP-2672, TEMP-3019, TEMP-4987, TEMP-5392, TEMP-7474, etc...

The collector was doing this in the main project so I pointed it to the temporary project to quit burning through insane amounts of issue numbers.  No one is manually creating issues in the project so there's no other way to account for this behavior.  I've tried to browse to some of the issues in between (TEMP-7300) but it does not exist.

The run up from TEMP-1428 to TEMP 7592 was only 5 days (March 29 to April 2).

I'm not filing this as a support request because I can't see any possible reason this would ever be desired behavior regardless of configuration.
fields.summary: Collector creates non-contiguous issues

fields.description:
In Jira 3.13 when uploading an attachment from a CIFS share, certain users are getting: error instantiating webwork.multipart.parser.class: com.atlassian.jira.web.MultipartRequestWrapper(original message: null)

I tried stopping Tomcat and deleting the work and temp directories, then starting Jira up, but that didnt resolve the issue.  If they copy the same file to their Desktop first, and then upload it as an attachment, they are able to create the issue successfully.
fields.summary: Error when uploading attachment from CIFS Share

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37777].
{panel}
{panel:title=Update 12th July 2019}
Hello everyone,

Wanted to drop a quick note to announce that this fix will be rolled out across Jira Cloud next week. Anytime you are mentioned in an issue, or in a comment, you will immediately receive an email stating you have been mentioned (it won't come as part of the new email batches, thus won't be time delayed).

Best Regards,

Josh Devenny, PM, Atlassian
{panel}
I have configured my Jira account to send emails. When someone mentions me in a comment or description, usually the email contains the text "x commented on", and only sometimes does it contain the text "x mentioned you".

I rely on the "x mentioned you" to filter incoming email using inbox rules. If it doesn't contain that phrase, it skips my inbox.

The behavior described above means that email updates for most comments where I am mentioned by name skip my inbox. Can it be fixed that such emails always contain "x mentioned you"?

Even more usefull would be if emails from Jira contain tags that can be used for inbox rules.

Thank you for considering!
fields.summary: Always use the phrase "mentioned you" in emails for comments or changes that mention me
Popular Script to be included as a feature in JIRA.
Better highlight selected columns option in the Issue Navigator
Only one attachment field
Bulk Delete Custom Fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37771].
  {panel}

I was trying to do a bulk change on a filtered list of over 50 issues.
I updated the first page, selecting 'current page' and performed the update.
When I stepped to the second page and again selected 'current page' for the bulk change, the list of issues I was shown was the first page again which had already been updated.
The only way to update more than the first 50 issues was to select the 'All <n> issues' option.

Repeatable every time.
fields.summary: JIRA 6.1.7 Bulk Change 'current page' only allows the first page to be updated
JIRA flooding logs with errors about missing filter module descriptors
Implement "first initial" avatars in JIRA core
Feature request to do bulk change in issue link
Width of 'Description' field in the 'Log Work' window is too narrow
Redmine Import will automatically import users

fields.description:
Reproducing steps: 
view an issue in JIRA
Go to issue link section 
click on + sign to add issue link
In a popup window - select option 'search for an issue' below issue link field
Provide advanced filter query that is expected to give number of stories as output say... 20 stories
Query used - issue key >= <issue key number> and issue key < = <issue key>
See the output - 

The output generated by advanced query over here is incorrect. In my query I was expecting around 40 issues in the output, however I could get only 8 initially, then 10, etc. There is no consistency in the behavior
fields.summary: Adding issue link selecting multiple issues
Limit a specific group to be added in the Notification Scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37759].
  {panel}

At the moment, the order of nodes in a Workflow XML Export seems somewhat arbitrary between nodes at the same level. This makes it difficult to compare two workflows (between a test and a 'live' workflow, for example). 

The most common issues for me are with actions and arguments.
* Not sure if it is sufficient to order actions just by ID or if order by name, then ID is better.
* Sorting args by name "<arg name=" would also help.

if I copy a workflow and then export the original and the copy to XML, I expect to see the same output (except for the nodes with description and date at the top ). This is not the case for us in JIRA 6.1.5.
fields.summary: Predictive export of Workflow XML

fields.description:
The STOP WATCHING feature no longer works. 
When clicking the link, the user is removed as a watcher. 
However, when refreshing the page, the user is added back as a watcher. 
This issue was discovered in the DOWNLOAD version of JIRA. 
An internet search has led to the discovery that the issue has also occured in the ON DEMAND version.
fields.summary: Removing Watchers
Ability to change order of System Fields on View Issue Screen
Display user info dialog whenever usernames are displayed
Clicking links in the development panel should open new tabs
Expand "WAS" JQL operator to support all system and custom fields
Enable websudo on JIRA Cloud export
Remove branches deleted from source repository from the JIRA issue development tab
Add reset token expiration time on email sent to new users
Need assistance configuring Active Directory authentication

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37743].
  {panel}

When in edit Diagram Draft, I go to the post functions page and don't have a navigation item that would take me back to the diagram page.

If I click the "Workflow (Draft)" link, it takes me to the text view but I want the diagram view which is the one I came from.

Navigation back to diagram needed in this page.
/secure/admin/workflows/ViewWorkflowTransition.jspa?workflowMode=draft&workflowName=Workflow&workflowTransition=431&workflowStep=1&descriptorTab=postfunctions
fields.summary: Improvement in workflow diagram navigation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37741].
  {panel}

Today we see JIRA issues on Calendar plugin marked with different colors, one per issue priority (ONLY). 

The calendar gadget could be much more useful with more choices for the origin of the color lozenges. I would actually like to see the status lozenge in the calendar gadget - to indicate at a glance the STATUS of the various issues on each day in the calendar. 

How about a pulldown menu for a choice of how to display the color lozenges on the calendar gadget?: 

-issue priority (current)
-issue status (status lozenges)
-project (JRA-33108)
fields.summary: Add the ability to choose what colors represent in JIRA Calendar Gadget

fields.summary: Upgrade to 6.2.2 fails with no unique user mapping
Gadget refresh button

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37737].
  {panel}

It's not possible to modify the default mail handler as per https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-31858 as the changes revert after maintenance / updates. 

However, adding a second handler that performs a similar function to the default handler also does not work as there is no way to prioritise which mail handler should take precedence over incoming mail. 

For example: A user wants to remove the duplicate text from reply emails before adding the new response text as a comment to an existing issue. 

* "incoming mail handler 1.jpg" shows comment text when both mail handlers are present
* "incoming mail handler 2.jpg" shows *preferred* comment text when default handler has been (temporarily) removed 

An improved behaviour would be to specify a mail handler as the default mail handler to use or to allow permanent changes to the default mail handler.
fields.summary: Default incoming mail handler conflicts with additional handlers
Allow subtasks to cross project boundaries

fields.description:
Hi,
We don't receive any notification, this affect all the users in our system.
We present this behavior from friday night, today we still having the same issue: https://latin3.atlassian.net/

Thanks.
Best Regards,
fields.summary: Users don't receive notifications.
Allow Admins to re-order Workflow Step IDs in OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37729].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of bug

When the user saves the JIRA Dashboard as a HTML file, at the bottom of the file, there will be a duplicate of the dashboard, with the same gadgets. However, the gadgets would not have any results, but would instead return an error.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# At a Dashboard, insert some gadgets
# Save the Dashboard as a HTML file
# Open the file, and scroll to the bottom
# There will be duplicate dashboard and gadgets :

!Dashboard.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When saving a JIRA Dashboard as HTML, there are duplicate gadgets at the bottom

fields.description:
for some reason the mail queue does not flush automatically at least since last night.
I had to flush it manually. 
Attached is a screenshot of the Mail Queue at 4:12 PM

I think there has been some Update to our OnDemand Jira.
fields.summary: mail queue does not flush automatically

fields.description:
As I navigate to Jira's website, the following message is shown:

"There is a problem with this website's security certificate. 

The security certificate presented by this website has expired or is not yet valid.

Security certificate problems may indicate an attempt to fool you or intercept any data you send to the server. 
We recommend that you close this webpage and do not continue to this website. 
Click here to close this webpage. 
Continue to this website (not recommended)." 

Ever since I received this message, the Attach a Screen Shot functionality in Jira does not work.  Jira is asking me to update my Java.  I have colleagues here at Wells Fargo who have the same issue. I've worked with our help desk and they have deteremine isn't a Java version related issue so I'm assuming it is a Jira issue. Please let me know what we can do to resolve this defect. 

Thanks,

Michael Kort
fields.summary: Cannot use Attach a Screenshot functionality

fields.description:
Hello,

There are no E-mail messages from JIRA from 03:00(AM).
All our users complain on this problem.
It's very important problem for us! Please help ASAP.
fields.summary: Last E-mail notification from JIRA at 03:00 (AM) MSK Time

fields.description:
Issue 1:
Our JIRA mailing system is not working.
This is to automated creation of cards, are not working for any of our clients.
Our incoming mail is for our clients, example psgam-support@lautus.net, which they mail to create issues, but nothing is being created in our jira project.
This is a big concern.
Please look at this asap

Issue 2:
Notifications are not being sent. (only by the users and not the automated issue creation from issue 1)
All updates that send notifications, are not being sent, they get stuck in the queue, and I need to manually flush them.

Thank you
Michelle
fields.summary: Email is not working, we need help urgently
Receiving doubled notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37716].
  {panel}

With custom user picker fields, you can choose particular people as the default user.

But I would like to be able to have the default user be "the person executing the transition that caused this screen to appear". The default should only be applied if the field is empty upon the transition starting.

Currently I am achieving this using some ajax and javascript code, but it doesn't always work.

I have investigated transition post-functions but they're not ideal, because I want a user to see that they have been set as the value for the field, while also having the option to change it to another value. Using a post-function either over-writes their value, or even if it doesn't, it looks odd to the user to leave a field blank and then have it automatically populated with their name when they click save - better to auto-populate it with their name when the form first loads so there is no confusion about what's happening.
fields.summary: User Picker custom field should have default option of 'Current user'
Elaborate on user installed plugin upgrade procedures in the documentation

fields.description:
Hi,

We're using JIRA.   https://corso3.atlassian.net/browse/SPP

We logged on today to find that there were no issues in our SPP project.
There is no history of them being deleted.

Can you advise as to where they are?

regards
Martin Owen

https://leaducate.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa&returnUrl=%2Fsecure%2FRapidBoard.jspa%3FrapidView%3D14%26view%3Dplanning%26selectedIssue%3DBU-312%26epics%3Dhidden

  Thanks

Description field for User Groups (in User Group Admin) would be helpful

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37708].
  {panel}

As a user, it would be great if there is more information on the pop-up box when the issue will be deleted. Information such as:
- This issue has been worked for x hours.
- These attachments <list of attachment> will be deleted.
- This issue is linked to <list of issues>
- This issue is associated to .....

The user that will delete the issue will take more precautions and help to prevent accidentally deleted issues.
fields.summary: More Information in the Pop-up Delete Issue confirmation box.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37707].
  {panel}

Some company have staff that has visually impaired and therefore uses a magnifier software called Dolphin Supernova 12.08. But, when they hover a mouse its becomes incredibly glitchy and magnifies the parts mouse over for a short period of time and not other parts and is ultimately unusable.

Temporary workaround:
# Navigate to 'file' -> 'New' -> 'map'.
# Set the map to 'No MSAA' option.
# Restart the client PC.
fields.summary: JIRA is not compatible with Dolphin Supernova product
Add support for field codes in workflow step properties

fields.description:
hello,

Actually we use JIRA 6.2, it's OK for us but at this moment we see that one of our user have a problem to do the filter. He receive an error like "an error occurred while communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again". It appears just for one of our user. It's OK for must.

Can you help us to resolve this problem.

Thanks in advance.

Jacyntha R.
fields.summary: Filter problem with JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37704].
  {panel}

Instead of receving lot's of mails when issues get updated.
It would be nice to show an alert inside the filter results.

Also:

As a jira user when I look in a changed issue
I expect to see the changes highlighted.

Added value: Easier to monitor changes.

Kind regards,
Danny
fields.summary: As a jira user I want to see updated issues highlighted in the filter results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37703].
  {panel}

Is it possible to show the source of a comment on a Jira issue. Like if the comment was added with a attachment or with a git commit message.

I would like it to look something like

Authors name added a comment - 6 minutes ago - with attachment link-and-name-to-attachment

And

Authors name added a comment - 6 minutes ago - from git [link to github|commit-hash]

Is it possible today? Or maybe feature you can implement in future version?
fields.summary: Show comment source

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37699].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
The Issue Type helper icon will show all issue types in JIRA, regardless of issue type scheme they are on. 

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Copy the Default Issue Type Scheme
# Edit the issue type scheme to have only 2 issue types
# Associate it to a new project
# Create new issue
# Click the Helper icon on Create Issue screen. 

h4. Result
You will see all *Issue Types*, *Priority Levels*, *Statuses* and *Resolutions* configured in JIRA

h4. Screenshot
!helper.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue Type Helper shows all issue types

fields.description:
Scenario:
Simple project with just 2 (custom) issue types and a field configuration scheme with only the Default entry (i.e. both issue types associated with the same field configuration).
We assume also a user who has access only to this project.
Opening basic searching -> More Criteria and searching for "Component", the (system) field does appear but it cannot be selected (it is greyed out) and an exclamation mark appears next to it.
According to the documentation:
Why is there a red exclamation mark in my field?
Some field values are only valid for a particular project/issue type context. For example, you may have configured a project to use a status In QA Review in its workflow. If you select this project and status in your search, then change the search to filter for a project that doesn't use n QA Review, the status will be invalid and ignored in the search.
If I also select explicitly the project name in the search criteria, then Component does appear and can be selected.
The question is why is it necessary to select also the project name in this case? The above reasoning does not apply.
Please note also that if I switch to Advanced Search and just type Component = xxx, it does work fine.
I believe this is a bug. Could you please try to reproduce it?

PS. The above problem happens also with other system fileds, such as Fix Version for example which also appears greyed out.

Thanks,
Ioannis
fields.summary: system fields greyed out in search screen
Bulk Change: Change Assignee

fields.description:
We encountered this severity error on Atlassian:

2014-03-27 16:31:46,897 http-bio-8080-exec-4 ERROR diego.natali 976x19145x1 1d147rj 10.3.0.96,192.168.113.2 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [plugin.emailissue.listener.IssueEventListener] There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
        - name:PostgreSQL
        - version:9.0.13
        - minor version:0
        - major version:9

fields.summary: Error Exception on Editing Issue
Add labels and popular issues back to the  project summary page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37690].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The issue navigator leaks memory in the client-side when browsing through the issue results in an issue search. This happens in both list view and details view, and has been tested in google chrome

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Google Chrome.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Execute a JQL Query with a significant number of total results (for example, 1000).
# Open Developer Tools --> Timeline - Check memory and Start Recording.
# Start browsing through the issues in the list (use j/k in list view / using the up-down arrows should be enough in details view).
# After you have done this for a number of issues (for example, 20), stop recording in the Timeline.
# *BUG* Notice the graph on memory consumption and how it keeps creeping up without memory being reclaimed.

h3. Expected Results

Memory usage does not keep increasing as you browse through issues. The allocated memory used when you go from one issue to another is reclaimed.

h3. Actual Results
Memory usage keeps increasing as you browse through all the issues in your results potentially leading to slugginess in the client.

h3.Workaround

Close the tab / Chrome and navigate to the page again in a new tab.

h3. Original Description

{quote}When leaving JIRA open in Chrome for an extended period of time, Chrome will eventually grow to consume a large percentage of the RAM on my machine. As much as 50% of available RAM will be set for that process in Chrome (not the only chrome process).

Ending this chrome task will close out only JIRA tabs, indicating that JIRA is causing the memory leak.
{quote}
fields.summary: Issue navigator leaks memory in the client-side whilst browsing through the issue results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37689].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Open JIRA 6.2.1 issue
# Create multiple comment in that issue
# Refresh the issue and make sure the "X Older Comments" is shown
# Click on the "X Older Comments" to expand the list of comments.
(i) X represent the number of comments.

h4. Expected Behaviour
The comments are expand correctly

h4. Actual Behaviour
The "X Older Comments" unable to expand to list of comments.

h4. Note:
* Unable to reproduce in JIRA 6.2
* IE 11 are working fine.
fields.summary: Issue tabs don't work in IE9
Allow Component Lead field to be used in the Issue Navigator
Time Tracker control is not visible in IE 11

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37686].
  {panel}

After upgrading to 6.2.1 and upgrading plugins, users get a prompt to authenticate with a linked JIRA instance:

Additional information may be available, please authenticate for more information:

  Authenticate with <other JIRA instance>.

Which is fine, but not all users can login to that instance, and some of them just click the X to make it go away. However, when they do, it doesn't stay gone. The next time the visit the page, it comes back.
fields.summary: prompt for authentication in linked JIRA won't stay gone
Create users through the mail handler but not necessary adding them to the jira-users group
Request to view the ACF requests/ issues created by me
When creating a sub-task please include the parent summary in the create issue screen

fields.description: Since upgrading to JIRA 6.1.7, Issue Navigator does not save my column settings consistently. These are saved filters, which I set up with specific columns before and after upgrading to 6.1.7. Some filters reflect the column settings I last set for them, others reflect whatever columns I chose to view most recently in a random filter. This is a big problem for shared filters that need to show specific types of info to other users.
fields.summary: Column Settings Not Saved in Issue Navigator

fields.description: We are seeing issues with some users being removed automatically from different groups that are managed from Jira.  In most cases these are Stash groups and we are managing Stash users through Jira and setting up stash permissions through groups created in Jira.  Our problem is a few users will have be removed from these groups and only be part of the jira-user group.  This is after they have been able to log in and use the group access for Stash groups.  We need to know why and how users are being removed because we can't track it anywhere but through Jira itself.
fields.summary: Users on Jira are being automatically removed from groups they were setup being members of the group
URL hack results in endless reload cycle when logged in as a non-admin.
Would like a notifications checkbox for comments in JIRA
a group to be a lead
